laboratory_examinations.findings: ALT 529 U/L, AST 306 U/L, Total Bilirubin normal
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Three months later, ALT 331 U/L, AST 540 U/L, Total Bilirubin 4.3 mg/dL; elevated levels continued with HCV load of 6,144,372 IU/mL

laboratory_examinations.date: Not specified (8 months after primary HCV infection)
Not specified (17 months after onset of primary HCV infection)
laboratory_examinations.findings: Albumin 1.8 g/dL, Total Bilirubin 11.6 mg/dL, INR 3.5, Platelet count 85,000 cells/μL, MELD score 30
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: MELD score rose to 34 over the following months before liver transplant

laboratory_examinations.findings: ALT 436 U/mL, AST 220 U/mL, Total Bilirubin normal, HCV load 26,600,000 IU/mL
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Four months post-primary HCV infection, ALT peaked at 622 U/L, AST 343 U/L, then remained in 200–300 U/L range

laboratory_examinations.findings: Grade 2 inflammation, stage 2 fibrosis, grade 2 steatohepatitis

laboratory_examinations.date: Not specified (19 months after primary HCV infection)
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: 10 months later, presented with ascites and esophageal varices; died 2 months after

laboratory_examinations.findings: ALT 114 U/L, AST 78 U/L, normal Total Bilirubin, HCV load 10,700,000 IU/mL
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: HCV serology was positive 28 months later; decompensated liver disease developed over the next 40 months

laboratory_examinations.date: Not specified (40 months after primary HCV infection)

laboratory_examinations.findings: AST 332 IU/L, ALT 367 IU/L, normal Total Bilirubin
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: 4 weeks later, HCV load 2410 IU/mL; 3 weeks later, HCV Ab positive and load >500,000 IU/mL

laboratory_examinations.findings: Grade 2 inflammation, stage 3 fibrosis, grade 1 steatohepatitis
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Repeat biopsy 1 year later showed grade 3 inflammation, stage 4 fibrosis
